page.title: 05THE STONEBOROUGH CENTRE
page.content: Opened late in 1976,{Stoneborough (763556) soon established itself as a major focus of Maidstone's shopping. There are 3 main shopping levels, connected by lifts, escalators and stairs,and a permanent security staff. The pressure on Maidstone's other car parks was eased by the centre's spaces for 1040 cars,260 of them on the roof. The roof also has office facilities. Despite the centre's attractions it has not become the pre-eminent retailing centre. W.H.Smith has just moved from{High Street}premises to the pedestrianised part of{Week Street,} which was originally less favoured than Stoneborough. Tesco has opened a new hypermarket at{Lunsford Park}and closed its supermarket in the Centre. Meanwhile the new{Broadway Centre}over the bridge further complicates likely future developments.
